page.title: 01The Rhu Peninsula
page.content: The Rhu peninsula reaches out from the road to Isles into the sea, dividing the sound of sleat from the sound of arisaig. its rocky coastline is punctuated with sand beaches through the peninsula consits mainly of rock. The several hills are richly covered in heather and wild grasses. The small valleys between the hills are mostly peat bogs where marsh grasses grow. Rhu is mainly baren and wild with only occasional trees and clumps of ferns to relieve the landscape. Small rock and sand islands surrounded its coast and to the west, the islands of rhun and eigg are visible. The main inhabitants are sheep-attended by he one croft. Most of Rhu has not changed for decades and remains almost untouched by the society of the 1980's, though more holidaymakers are using its single track than before.
